title: Gox
content:
Gox # HTML knowledge required Composable pure function view layer You can use any HTML element as Go func Advice
Use import alias import . “github.com/daarlabs/arcanum/gox” Be careful with naming convention to prevent HTML nodes names collisions Sample code # package app import ( . "github.com/daarlabs/arcanum/gox" ) func Page() string { return Render( Html( Lang("en"), Head( Title(Text("Example app")), ), Body( H1(Text("Example page")), P(Text("Example paragraph")), ), ), ) } Render # Render function transform Gox nodes to string
Render( Div(Text("Gox")) ) Text # For the composition feature, we need to use text node, instead of primitive string
H1(Text("Headline 1")) P(Text("Paragraph")) Elements # Div() H1() P() Attributes # Button( Type("submit"), CustomData("track", "submit-button"), ) A( Href("/"), Text("Go to homepage"), ) Shared # Some nodes have shared name (label, style, title, …) Modifiers Element(), Attribute() will change node type Label(Text("E-mail")) Style(Element(), Raw("body{background:red;}")) Fragment # Wrapper, when you need group nodes to single node
Fragment( Div(), Span(), H1(), ) Write # If you have io.Writer, like http.ResponseWriter, you can use Write(w io.Writer, nodes …Node) function
Write(w, Div(Text("this is the response"))) Append # After node initialization, you can append nodes to the node
Append( Div(), Text("Appended node"), ) Raw # Pure HTML can be used with Raw() node
Raw(`<div>Raw element</div>`) Factory # If some element, attribute missing, or you have some custom features, you can create you own Gox nodes
CustomElement := CreateElement("my-custom-element") CustomAttribute := CreateAttribute[string]("my-custom-attribute") CustomElement( CustomAttribute("some-value"), ) Plugin # You can also create custom nodes, as struct, with only one required method Node() Node
type MyPlugin struct { SomeValue string } func (p MyPlugin) Node() Node { return Div( Text(p.SomeValue) ) } Clsx # Built-in plugin to conditional classes
Div( Clsx{ "class-1 class-2": true, "class-3": false, } ) Component # Gox offers compose power to create stateless UI components
func MainButton(content string) Node { return Button( Type("button"), CustomData("test", "test-id"), Text(content), ) }
